New Records: The partnership of 131 runs between Jones and Gous came at 14.29 runs per over, the highest run-rate for any century partnership at the T20 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Aaron Jones ended the match with 94* (40), setting a new record for the highest score in a T20 World Cup match for the United States.
Andries Gous scored 65 (46), contributing significantly to the United States' victory.
Pre-Game Insights: USA were favourites against Canada in the opening match.
Post-Match Reflections: USA captain Monank Patel expressed pride in the team's performance and their resilience.
Canada captain Saad Bin Zafar acknowledged the team's effort and looked forward to improving in the next game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in Dallas, Texas, during the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024.
Aaron Jones was named the Player of the Match and CricketInfo's MVP.
Others: The United States won the match by 7 wickets with 14 balls remaining.
Canada scored 194/5 in their innings, while the United States scored 197/3 in their chase.
